title: Aga_Khan_IV
extract: Prince Karim Al-Husseini Aga Khan, known as the Aga Khan IV, was a religious leader and businessman best known as the 49th imam of Isma'ilism from 1957 until his death in 2025. He inherited the Nizari imamate and the title of Aga Khan at the age of 20 upon the death of his grandfather, the Aga Khan III. He was also known by the religious title Mawlānā Hazar Imam by his Isma'ili followers.

title: Gaza_Strip
extract: The Gaza Strip, also known simply as Gaza, is a small territory located on the eastern coast of the Mediterranean Sea; it is the smaller of the two Palestinian territories, the other being the West Bank, that make up the State of Palestine. Inhabited by mostly Palestinian refugees and their descendants, Gaza is one of the most densely populated territories in the world. An end of 2024 estimate puts the population of the Strip at 2.1 million. Gaza is bordered by Egypt on the southwest and Israel on the east and north. The territory has been under Israeli occupation since the 1967 Six-Day War.
trending_reason: The Gaza Strip article is likely trending on Wikipedia due to the ongoing military operations by the IDF, which have significantly escalated since October 2023, impacting a large portion of the territory and drawing international attention.

title: Aga_Khan
extract: Aga Khan is a title held by the Imām of the Nizari Ismāʿīli Shias. From 1957 to 2025, the holder of the title was the 49th Imām, Prince Shah Karim al-Husseini, Aga Khan IV (1936–2025). The current holder of the title is the 50th Imām, Prince Rahim Aga Khan, Aga Khan V.
trending_reason: The Aga Khan article is trending on Wikipedia due to the recent transition of leadership following the death of Aga Khan IV on February 4, 2025, and the ascension of Aga Khan V.

title: Pam_Bondi
extract: Pamela Jo Bondi is an American attorney, lobbyist, and politician who has served as the 87th United States attorney general since 2025. A member of the Republican Party, she served as Florida attorney general from 2011 to 2019, the first woman elected to the office.

[[Stetson University]] ([[Juris Doctor|JD]]) }} '''Pamela Jo Bondi''' (born November 17, 1965) is an American attorney, lobbyist, and politician who has served as the 87th [[United States Attorney General|United States attorney general]] since 2025. A member of the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]], she served as [[Florida Attorney General|Florida attorney general]] from 2011 to 2019, the first woman elected to the office. In 2020, Bondi was one of President [[Donald Trump]]'s defense lawyers during his [[first impeachment trial of Donald Trump|first impeachment trial]]. She became a vocal supporter of Trump's [[attempts to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election]], and made claims of election fraud. By 2024, she led the legal arm of the Trump-aligned [[America First Policy Institute]]. On November 21, 2024, [[-elect|President-elect]] Trump announced she would be nominated for attorney general. She was confirmed in a 54–46 Senate vote on February 4, 2025,{{cite web |last1=Mansfield |first1=Aysha Bagchi and Erin |title=Trump nominee Pam Bondi confirmed by Senate as US attorney general |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2025/02/04/pam-bondi-confirmation-attorney-general/78164717007/ |website=USA TODAY |access-date=5 February 2025 |date=4 February 2025}}{{Cite web |last=Beitsch |first=Rebecca |date=February 4, 2025 |title=Senate Confirms Pam Bondi to lead the Justice Department |url=https://thehill.com/regulation/court-battles/5126838-pam-bondi-ag-justice-department-confirmed/ |access-date=February 4, 2025 |website=The Hill}} and sworn in the next day.{{cite web |last1=Ogles |first1=Jacob |title=Pam Bondi sworn in as Attorney General |url=https://floridapolitics.com/archives/719527-pam-bondi-sworn-in-as-attorney-general/ |publisher=[[Florida Politics]] |access-date=5 February 2025 |date=5 February 2025}} ==Early life and education== Pamela Jo Bondi{{Cite web |title=Member Profile – Pamela Jo Bondi – The Florida Bar |url=https://www.floridabar.org/directories/find-mbr/profile/?num=886440 |access-date=November 22, 2024 |website=[[The Florida Bar]] |language=en-US}} was born on November 17, 1965. Her hometown is [[Temple Terrace, Florida]]. Her father, Joseph Bondi, was a city council member and then mayor of Temple Terrace. She is a graduate of [[C. Leon King High School]] in [[Tampa, Florida|Tampa]].[https://www.wetheitalians.com/single_post/first-italian-american-new-trump-administration-will-be-pamela-jo-bondi "The first Italian American in the new Trump administration will be Pamela Jo Bondi"], Wetheitalians.com. November 22, 2024. Bondi received a [[Bachelor of Arts]] with a major in [[criminal justice]] from the [[University of Florida]] in 1987 and a [[Juris Doctor]] from the [[Stetson University College of Law]] in 1990.{{Cite web |title=Hon. Pam Bondi |url=https://www.concordia.net/community/pam-bondi/ |access-date=November 22, 2024 |website=Concordia |language=en-US}} She was a member of the [[Delta Delta Delta]] [[Fraternities and sororities|sorority]] as an undergraduate student.{{Cite web|url=https://www.businessobserverfl.com/article/legally-bondi|title=Legally Bondi | Business Observer|date=November 5, 2010|website=Business Observer|access-date=July 24, 2019|archive-date=July 24, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190724153835/https://

title: Aga_Khan_V
extract: Prince Rahim al-Hussaini Aga Khan, known as the Aga Khan V, is the 50th Imam, or Hazar Imam, of the Shia Nizari Isma'ili Muslims. He is the second of the Aga Khan IV's four children, and succeeded his father upon his death in February 2025. Based in Geneva, Switzerland, he has been actively involved for many years in the governance of the Aga Khan Development Network (AKDN).

[[Zahra Aga Khan|Princess Zahra Aga Khan]] (sister) | religion = [[Nizari Isma'ilism|Nizari Isma'ili]] [[Shia Islam]] }} {{Noorani family}} {{Ismailism}} '''Prince Rahim al-Hussaini Aga Khan''' ({{Langx|fa|رحیم آقا خان}};{{Lrm}} born 12 October 1971), known as the '''Aga Khan V''' ({{langx|fa|آقاخان پنجم}}), is the 50th [[Imamate in Nizari doctrine|Imam]], or Hazar Imam, of the [[Shia Islam|Shia]] [[Nizari Isma'ilism|Nizari]] [[Isma'ilism|Isma'ili]] Muslims. He is the second of the [[Aga Khan IV]]'s four children, and succeeded his father upon his death in February 2025. Based in [[Geneva]], Switzerland, he has been actively involved for many years in the governance of the [[Aga Khan Development Network]] (AKDN). == Early life and education == Prince Rahim Aga Khan was born on 12 October 1971, in [[Geneva]], [[Switzerland]]. He is the eldest son and second oldest of three children born to the [[Aga Khan IV]] (Prince Karim Al-Husseini) and his first wife Princess [[Salimah Aga Khan]] (née Sarah Croker-Poole), a British title: Isma'ilism
extract: Isma'ilism is a branch of Shia Islam. The Isma'ili get their name from their acceptance of Imam Isma'il ibn Jafar as the appointed spiritual successor (imām) to Ja'far al-Sadiq, wherein they differ from the Twelver Shia, who accept Musa al-Kazim, the younger brother of Isma'il, as the true Imām.

Tucker|Priscilla Roberts|2008|p=917}} The Isma'ili ({{IPAc-en|ˌ|ɪ|z|m|ɑː|ˈ|ɪ|l|iː}}){{Cite web|title=Definition of Ismaili|url=https://www.dictionary.com/browse/ismaili|access-date=2023-03-29|website=www.dictionary.com|language=en}} get their name from their acceptance of Imam [[Isma'il ibn Jafar]] as the appointed spiritual successor ([[Imamate in Nizari doctrine|imām]]) to [[Ja'far al-Sadiq]], wherein they differ from the [[Twelver Shia]], who accept [[Musa al-Kazim]], the younger brother of Isma'il, as the [[Imamah (Shia doctrine)|true Imām]].{{Cite web|url=https://iranicaonline.org/|title=Welcome to Encyclopaedia Iranica|first=Encyclopaedia Iranica|last=Foundation|website=iranicaonline.org}} After the death of [[Muhammad ibn Isma'il]] in the 8th century CE, the teachings of Ismailism further transformed into the belief system as it is known today, with an explicit concentration on the deeper, esoteric meaning ({{transliteration|ar|[[batin (Islam)|batin]]}}) of the Islamic religion. title: Salimah_Aga_Khan
extract: Salimah Aga Khan, also known as Begum Salimah Aga Khan, is a former fashion model. She is the mother of Aga Khan V, imam of the Nizari Isma'ili Muslims, and she is an ex-wife of the 49th Ismaili Shia Imam and 4th Aga Khan, Prince Karim Aga Khan.
text:
{{Short description|Fashion model and mother of Aga Khan V}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=September 2018}} {{BLP refimprove|date=December 2016}} {{Infobox royalty | image = | name = Salimah Aga Khan | title = [[Begum]] [[Aga Khan]] | birth_name = Sarah Frances Croker Poole | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1940|01|28|df=y}} | birth_place = [[New Delhi]], [[British India]] | death_place = | burial_date = | burial_place = | spouse = {{plainlist| * {{marriage|Lord James Charles Crichton-Stuart
|1959|1968|end=div}} * {{marriage|[[Aga Khan IV]]
|1969|1995|end=div}} }} | issue = {{plainlist| *[[Zahra Aga Khan|Princess Zahra Aga Khan]] *[[Aga Khan V|Prince Rahim Aga Khan (Aga Khan V)]] *[[Hussain Aga Khan|Prince Hussain Aga Khan]]}} | mother = Jean Margaret Watson | father = Arthur Eric Croker Poole | religion = [[Nizari]] [[Ismaili]] [[Shia Islam]] }} '''Salimah Aga Khan''' (''née'' '''Sarah Frances Croker Poole'''; born 28 January 1940), also known as [[Begum]] Salimah Aga Khan, is a former fashion model. She is the mother of [[Aga Khan V]], imam of the Nizari Isma'ili Muslims, and she is an ex-wife of the 49th [[Isma'ilism|Ismaili]] [[Shia Islam|Shia]] [[Imam]] and 4th Aga Khan, [[Prince Karim Aga Khan]]. ==Early life== Princess Salimah was born at [[New Delhi]], [[British India]], as Sarah Frances Croker Poole.{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/aga-khan-fails-to-stop-former-wifes-jewellery-sale-1581347.html|title=Aga Khan fails to stop former wife's jewellery sale|date=11 November 1995|website=Independent.co.uk|accessdate=11 April 2018}} She is the daughter of [[Lieutenant-Colonel]] Arthur Eric Croker Poole and his wife, Jean Margaret Watson. She was one of the last generation of [[debutantes]] to be [[Queen Charlotte's Ball|presented]] to the Queen, in 1958.{{cite web|title=High Society: Whatever happened to the last of the debs?|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/this-britain/high-society-whatever-happened-to-the-last-of-the-debs-417273.html|date=24 September 2006|website=Independent|access-date=19 January 2022}} She married, firstly, Lord James Charles Crichton-Stuart, son of [[John Crichton-Stuart, 5th Marquess of Bute]] and Lady Eileen Beatrice Forbes, on 25 June 1959. She and Lord James Charles Crichton-Stuart were divorced in 1968. She married, secondly, [[Aga Khan IV|Prince Karim Aga Khan IV]], son of [[Prince Aly Khan]] and Hon. Princess Taj-ud-dawlah Aga Khan, in 1969. During her marriage to the Aga Khan, her official name was Her Highness The Begum Aga Khan, although she remained informally known as ''Sally''. Following their divorce in 1995, she kept the title of "Princess" (but losing the style "Highness"). In November 1995, "Jewels from the Personal Collection of Princess Salimah Aga Khan" realised $27,682,601 ({{Inflation|US|27682601|1995|r=0|fmt=eq|cursign=$}}) at [[Christie's]], Geneva.{{cite web|url=http://www.jewelsdujour.com/2014/01/top-ten-most-expensive-private-jewelry-collections-sold-at-auction/|title=Top Ten Most Expensive Private Jewelry Collections Sold at Auction|date=13 January 2014|website=Jewelsdujour.com|accessdate=20 December 2016}} ==Charitable career== She is now a child-welfare activist and a prominent supporter of the charity [[SOS Children's Villages]], becoming its first International Ambassador. {{cite web|url=http://www.sameeragokalfoundation.org/images/PrincessSalimah.pdf|format=PDF|title=Interview with Princess Salimah Aga Khan|website=Sameeragokalfoundation.org|accessdate=11 April 2018}} As part of her welfare activity she has also aided [[Afghan refugees]]. She has also been active in the [[Aga Khan Development Network]]. ==Personal life== She has three children with the Aga Khan: Princess [[Zahra Aga Khan]] (born 18 September 1970), Prince [[Rahim Aga Khan]] (born 12 October 1971) and Prince [[Hussain Aga Khan]] (born 10 April 1974). Salimah Aga Khan has lived in [[Geneva]], Switzerland, since 1969. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Aga Khan, Salimah}} [[Category:1940 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:British debutantes]] [[Category:Noorani family]] [[Category:Jewellery collectors]] [[Category:British expatriates in Switzerland]]

title: Unit_731
extract: Unit 731 , short for Manchu Detachment 731 and also known as the Kamo Detachment and the Ishii Unit, was a covert biological and chemical warfare research and development unit of the Imperial Japanese Army that engaged in lethal human experimentation and biological weapons manufacturing during the Second Sino-Japanese War (1937–1945) and World War II. Estimates vary as to how many were killed. Between 1936 and 1945, roughly 14,000 victims were murdered in Unit 731. It is estimated that at least 300,000 individuals have died due to infectious illnesses caused by the activities of Unit 731 and its affiliated research facilities. It was based in the Pingfang district of Harbin, the largest city in the Japanese puppet state of Manchukuo and had active branch offices throughout China and Southeast Asia.
trending_reason: The Unit 731 article is trending on Wikipedia due to renewed interest and discussions surrounding the historical atrocities committed by the unit during World War II, especially in light of ongoing debates about war crimes and ethical considerations in medical research.

title: Aga_Khan_III
extract: Sir Sultan Mahomed Shah, known as Aga Khan III, was the 48th imam of the Nizari Ism'aili branch of Shia Islam. He was one of the founders and the first permanent president of the All-India Muslim League (AIML). His goal was the advancement of Muslim agendas and the protection of Muslim rights in British India. The League, until the late 1930s, was not a large organisation but represented landed and commercial Muslim interests as well as advocating for British education during the British Raj. There were similarities in Aga Khan's views on education with those of other Muslim social reformers, but the scholar Shenila Khoja-Moolji argues that he also expressed a distinct interest in advancing women's education for women themselves. Aga Khan called on the British Raj to consider Muslims to be a separate nation within India, the famous 'Two Nation Theory'. Even after he resigned as president of the AIML in 1912, he still exerted a major influence on its policies and agendas. He was nominated to represent India at the League of Nations in 1932 and served as President of the 18th Assembly of The League of Nations (1937–1938).

'''Sir Sultan Mahomed Shah''' ({{Langx|ar|سلطان محمد شاه|translit=Sulṭān Muḥammad Shāh}}; 2 November 1877{{snd}}11 July 1957), known as '''Aga Khan III''' ({{Langx|fa|آقا خان سوم|translit=Āqā Khān Suwwūm}}), was the 48th [[Imamate in Nizari doctrine|imam]] of the [[Nizari]] [[Isma'ili|Ism'aili]] branch of Shia Islam. He was one of the founders and the first permanent president of the [[All-India Muslim League]] (AIML). His goal was the advancement of Muslim agendas and the protection of Muslim rights in British India. The League, until the late 1930s, was not a large organisation but represented landed and commercial Muslim interests as well as advocating for British education during the [[British Raj]].<ref>{{cite book |author=John Keay |title=India: A History |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=3aeQqmcXBhoC&pg=PA468 |year=2001 |publisher=Grove Press |page=468 |isbn=978-0-8021-3797-5}}</ref> There were similarities in Aga Khan's views on education with those of other Muslim social reformers, but the scholar [[Shenila Khoja-Moolji]] argues that he also expressed a distinct interest in advancing women's education for women themselves.<ref>{{Cite book |last=Khoja-Moolji |first=Shenila |title=Forging the Ideal Educated Girl: The Production of Desirable Subjects in Muslim South Asia |publisher=University of California Press |year=2018 |isbn=978-0-520-29840-8 |location=Oakland, CA |pages=chapter 2}}</ref> Aga Khan called on the British Raj to consider Muslims to be a separate nation within India, the famous '[[Two Nation Theory]]'. Even after he resigned as president of the AIML in 1912, he still exerted a major influence on its policies and agendas. He was nominated to represent India at the [[League of Nations]] in 1932 and served as President of the 18th Assembly of The [[League of Nations]] (1937–1938).<ref>{{Cite web |language=en |url=https://www.nottingham.ac.uk/research/groups/conferencing-the-international/delegates/people.aspx?id=0631f215-31b5-48fb-a4be-31c9df759400 |title=Conferencing the International.}}</ref>

== Early life ==
He was born in [[Karachi]], [[Sindh]] (now in [[Pakistan]]), in 1877 under the [[British Raj]], to [[Aga Khan II]] (who had emigrated from [[Persia]]) and his third wife,<ref name="Daftary-Ismailis">{{cite book |title=The Ismā'īlīs: Their History and Doctrin
trending_reason: The Aga Khan III article is trending on Wikipedia due to the recent passing of his grandson, Aga Khan IV, and the subsequent transition of leadership to Aga Khan V, which has sparked renewed interest in the historical significance of Aga Khan III's contributions to the Ismaili community and Indian politics.

title: Eddie_Gaedel
extract: Edward Carl Gaedel was the smallest player to appear in a Major League Baseball game.
text:
{{short description|American baseball player (1925-1961)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=July 2014}} {{Infobox baseball biography | image = Gaedel.jpg | caption = Gaedel batting in August 1951,
in his only plate appearance in [[Major League Baseball|baseball]] | name = Eddie Gaedel | team = | number = | position = [[Pinch hitter]] | bats = Right | throws = Left | birth_date = {{Birth date|1925|6|8}} | birth_place = [[Chicago]], Illinois, U.S. | death_date = {{death date and age|1961|6|18|1925|6|8}} | death_place = Chicago, Illinois, U.S. |debutleague = MLB | debutdate = August 19 | debutyear = 1951 | debutteam = St. Louis Browns |finalleague = MLB | finaldate = August 19 | finalyear = 1951 | finalteam = St. Louis Browns |statleague = MLB | stat1label = [[On-base percentage]] | stat1value = 1.000 | stat2label = [[Batting average (baseball)|Batting average]] | stat2value = – | stat3label = [[Plate appearance]]s | stat3value = 1 | stat4label = [[Base on balls]] | stat4value = 1 | teams = * [[St. Louis Browns]] ({{mlby|1951}}) | highlights = * Shortest player in Major League Baseball history }} '''Edward Carl Gaedel''' (June 8, 1925 – June 18, 1961) was the smallest player to appear in a [[Major League Baseball]] game.{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=QmNIAAAAIBAJ&pg=1159%2C4649339 |work=Youngstown Vindicator |location=(Ohio) |agency=AP photo |title=Veeck's latest gimmick - a midget big leaguer |date=August 20, 1951 |page=8}} Gaedel gained recognition in the second game of a [[1951 St. Louis Browns season|St. Louis Browns]] [[doubleheader (baseball)|doubleheader]] on August 19, 1951.{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=rS5WAAAAIBAJ&pg=4920%2C3803143 |work=Spokesman-Review |location=(Spokane, Washington) |agency=Associated Press |title=Browns hit all-time low; use 3-foot 7-inch player |date=August 20, 1951 |page=7}} Weighing {{convert|60|lb|kg}} and standing {{convert|3|ft|7|in|cm}} tall, he became the shortest player in the history of the Major Leagues. Gaedel made a single plate appearance and was walked with four consecutive balls before being replaced by a [[pinch-runner]] at [[Base (baseball)#First base|first base]]. His jersey, bearing the uniform number "{{frac|1|8}}", is displayed in the [[St. Louis Cardinals Hall of Fame Museum|St. Louis Cardinals Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum]]. [[St. Louis Browns]] owner [[Bill Veeck]], in his 1962 autobiography ''Veeck – As in Wreck'', said of Gaedel, "He was, by golly, the best darn midget who ever played big-league ball. He was also the only one."{{cite book |last=Veeck |first=Bill |title=Veeck – As in Wreck |url=http://www.press.uchicago.edu/Misc/Chicago/852180.html |publisher=University of Chicago |access-date=August 30, 2011}} == Early life == Edward Carl Gaedele (Gaedel) was born in [[Cook County, Illinois]], on June 8, 1925.U.S., World War II Draft Cards Young Men, 1940–1947 for Edward Carl Gaedel His father, Carl Gaedele (1886–1949), was a Lithuanian immigrant who managed a department store and worked as a parking lot checker. His mother, Helen (née Janicki), was a homemaker. In 1930, the Gaedele family lived in Chicago's [[Garfield Ridge, Chicago|Garfield Ridge]] neighborhood, and by 1940, the family lived in [[Back of the Yards, Chicago|Back of the Yards]].National Archives and Records Administration. 1930 Census.{{Cite web | title=Edward Gaedele in the 1940 United States Federal Census | url=https://www.ancestry.com/discoveryui-content/view/144462790:2442 | website=Ancestry.com }}Name: Carl Gaedele Birth Date: 24 Sep 1886 Service Number: 3779726 Unit: Jefferson Brks, Mo. 27th Recruit Co., GENERAL SERV. INFANTRY Enlistment Date: 1 Oct 1918 Discharge Date: 9 Dec 1918 Death Date: 14 Aug 1949 Cemetery: St Mary's Cemetery Cemetery Location: Evergreen Park, Illinois, USA ==Appearance== Gaedel had worked as a [[riveter]] during [[World War II]], as he was able to crawl inside the wings of airplanes.{{cite web | url=https://www.espn.com/page2/tvlistings/show73transcript.html | title=Outside the Lines: At Bat – Eddie Gaedel | date=August 19, 2001 | publisher=ESPN Page2 | access-date=April 11, 2022}} He was a professional performer, belonging to the [[American Guild of Variety Artists]] (AGVA). After the war, Gaedel was hired in 1946 by [[Mercury Records]] as a mascot to portray the "Mercury Man". He sported a winged hat similar to the record label's logo, to promote Mercury recordings.{{cite web |url=http://www.robertedwardauctions.com/auction/2005/483.html |title=The Only Eddie Gaedel Signed Photograph Known To Exist |publisher=Robertedwardauctions.com |access-date=April 2, 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130513014433/http://www.robertedwardauction
trending_reason: The Eddie Gaedel article is trending on Wikipedia due to the recent anniversary of his historic Major League Baseball appearance on August 19, 1951, which continues to spark discussions about his unique legacy as the shortest player in MLB history.

title: Salwa_Aga_Khan
extract: Princess Salwa Aga Khan is an American former fashion model. She began her modelling career in 2008, participating in the Ford Models Supermodel of the World and walking in New York Fashion Week. She has walked the runway for Gucci, Christian Lacroix, Lanvin, Hermès, and Valentino. Salwa has appeared on the covers of Amica, Cover Magazine, Vogue China, Vogue Japan, Vogue Germany, Vogue México y Latinoamérica, Elle, Allure, and Numero and in editorials in Dazed & Confused, V, and Vogue Italia. She has been the face of Prada, Armani's Code Fragrance, and Moschino's Pink Bouquet fragrance and modelled in advertisement campaigns for Calvin Klein, Etro, Diane von Fürstenberg, Peek & Cloppenburg, and The Limited.

{{Short description|American fashion model (born 1988)}}
{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2021}}

Princess '''Salwa Aga Khan''' (née  '''Kendra Irene Spears'''; born August 5, 1988) is an American former fashion model. She began her modelling career in 2008, participating in the [[Ford Models Supermodel of the World]] and walking in [[New York Fashion Week]]. She has walked the runway for [[Gucci]], [[Christian Lacroix]], [[Lanvin (clothing)|Lanvin]], [[Hermès]], and [[Valentino SpA|Valentino]]. Salwa has appeared on the covers of ''[[Amica (magazine)|Amica]]'', ''[[Cover Magazine (publication)|Cover Magazine]]'', ''[[Vogue China]]'', ''[[Vogue Japan]]'', ''[[Vogue Germany]]'', ''[[Vogue México y Latinoamérica]]'', ''[[Elle Magazine|Elle]]'', ''[[Allure (magazine)|Allure]]'', and ''[[Numéro|Numero]]'' and in editorials in ''[[Dazed & Confused (magazine)|Dazed & Confused]]'', ''[[V (American magazine)|V]]'', and ''[[Vogue Italia]]''. She has been the face of [[Prada]], [[Armani]]'s Code Fragrance, and [[Moschino]]'s Pink Bouquet fragrance and modelled in advertisement campaigns for [[Calvin Klein]], [[Etro]], [[Diane von Fürstenberg]], [[Peek & Cloppenburg]], and [[The Limited]].

In 2013, she married Prince Rahim Aga Khan (now the [[Aga Khan V]]), the eldest son of [[Aga Khan IV]], at the [[Bellerive Castle|Château de Bellerive]] in Switzerland. Upon her marriage, she converted to Islam and adopted the name Salwa, meaning "solace" in Arabic. She and Prince Rahim have two sons.

==Early life and education==
Kendra Irene Spears was born on August 5, 1988, in [[Seattle]], [[Washington (state)|Washington]].{{Citation needed|date=December 2021}} She graduated from [[South Kitsap High School]] with an [[associate's degree]] acquired through a dual-credit high school and college program (Running Start).<ref name=nymag>{{cite web|url=https://www.nymag.com/fashion/models/kspears/kendraspears |title= Profile of Kendra Spears at NYMAG.com|work=[[New York (magazine)|New York Magazine]]|access-date= October 17, 2009}}</ref> She then attended [[Portland State University]] to study [[sociology]],<ref name=nymag/> and obtained a [[Bachelor of Arts|BA]] in sociology from the [[University of Washington]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.akdn.org/Content/1176|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130503055059/www.akdn.org/Content/1176|url-status=dead|archive-date=2013-05-03|title=The Aga Khan Announces the Engagement of His Eldest Son (p. 1176) |website=akdn.org}}</ref> In January 2008, Salwa began her modeling career in [[New York City]] and went on to become a successful fashion model.

==Career==
In January 2008, Salwa participated in the [[Ford Models Supermodel of the World]] competition, after winning a modeling contest via [[MySpace]]. After the competition ended, she gained a contract with [[Ford Models]] of New York and debuted at [[New York Fashion Week]] in September 2008. After success in New York, Salwa went on to walk for the most prestigious designers in [[Milan]] and [[Paris]], including [[Gucci]], [[Christian Lacroix]], [[Lanvin (clothing)|Lanvin]], [[Hermès]], and [[Valentino SpA|Valentino]].<ref name=style.com>{{Cite web|url=https://www.farfetch.com/|title=Designer Fashion - Farfetch. The World Through Fashion|website=www.farfetch.com}}</ref>

Shortly after the show season ended in October, Salwa appeared on a succession of covers of the [[Denmark|Danish]] fashion magazine ''[[Cover Magazine (publication)|Cover]]'' and the [[Italy|Italian]] magazine ''[[Amica (magazine)|Amica]]''.<ref name=models.com>{{cite web|url=http://www.models.com/models/kendra-spears|title=Kendra Sprears at Models.com|work=Models.com|access-date=October 17, 2009}}</ref> The covers were followed by a ''[[Dazed & Confused (magazine)|Dazed & Confused]]'' editorial featuring new faces of the season as well as editorials for ''[[V (American magazine)|V]]'' and ''[[Vogue Italia]]''.<ref name=models.com/>

For the Fall 2009 season, Salwa was photographed by [[Steven Meisel]] as one of the faces of [[Prada]]. Shortly afterwards, she moved back to Seattle to complete her degree at [[University of Washington]]. Although the move limited her ability to work, she still managed to shoot advertising campaigns including Stefanel shot by [[Mario Testino]], [[Calvin Klein]
trending_reason: The Salwa Aga Khan article is trending on Wikipedia due to the recent news surrounding her divorce from Prince Rahim Aga Khan, which has generated significant public interest in her life and career.
